usbsimulator.protocol.field module

class usbsimulator.protocol.field.USBField(size_in_bits)[source]

Bases: object

Abstract class representing an USB field.

val()[source]
class usbsimulator.protocol.field.Pid(value)[source]

Bases: IntEnum

Valid PID values for a USB packet, values are MSB first.

Please see 8.3.1 from USB1.1 specification.

TOKEN_OUT = 225
TOKEN_IN = 105
TOKEN_SOF = 165
TOKEN_SETUP = 45
DATA_DATA0 = 195
DATA_DATA1 = 75
HANDSHAKE_ACK = 210
HANDSHAKE_NACK = 90
HANDSHAKE_STALL = 30
SPECIAL_PRE = 60
class usbsimulator.protocol.field.EndpointField(endpoint: int)[source]

Bases: USBField

Endpoint field, values are MSB first

Parameters:

endpoint (int) – The endpoint value must be on 3 bits max

Example:

1my_endpoint_value = 3
2f = EndpointField(my_endpoint_value)
class usbsimulator.protocol.field.PidField(pid: Pid)[source]

Bases: USBField

Pid field for a USB packet.

Parameters:

pid (Pid) – The value of the Pid

Example:

1my_pid = Pid.TOKEN_SOF
2f = PidField(my_pid)
class usbsimulator.protocol.field.AddressField(address: int)[source]

Bases: USBField

Address field, values are MSB first

Parameters:

address (int) – The address value must be on 6 bits max

Example:

1my_addr = 0b101101
2f = AddressField(my_addr)
class usbsimulator.protocol.field.FramenumberField(framenumber: int)[source]

Bases: USBField

Field containing the frame number of a USB packet.

Parameters:

framenumber (int) – the number of the frame

Example:

1frame_nb = 0x1ea
2f = FramenumberField(frame_nb)
class usbsimulator.protocol.field.DataField(data: bytes)[source]

Bases: USBField

Data field for a USB packet.

Parameters:

data (bytes) – the data to be stored in the field, MSB first

Example:

1my_data = b'Very important data to send by USB !'
2f = DataField(my_data)
